metadata.title: W3Schools.com

metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Legal Color Values
CSS Colors
Colors in CSS can be specified by the following methods:
content.html: Colors in CSS can be specified by the following methods:

content.text: Hexadecimal Colors
A hexadecimal color is specified with: #RRGGBB, where the RR (red), GG (green) and BB (blue) hexadecimal integers specify the components of the color. All values must be between 00 and FF.
content.html: A hexadecimal color is specified with: #RRGGBB, where the RR (red), GG (green) and BB (blue) hexadecimal integers specify the components of the color. All values must be between 00 and FF.

content.text: For example, the #0000ff value is rendered as blue, because the blue component is set to its highest value (ff) and the others are set to 00.
content.html: For example, the #0000ff value is rendered as blue, because the blue component is set to its highest value (ff) and the others are set to 00.

content.code_html:
#p1 {background-color: #ff0000;}   /* red */
#p2 {background-color: #00ff00;}   /* green */
#p3 {background-color: #0000ff;}   /* blue */

content.text: Hexadecimal Colors With Transparency
A hexadecimal color is specified with: #RRGGBB. To add transparency, add two additional digits between 00 and FF.
content.html: A hexadecimal color is specified with: #RRGGBB. To add transparency, add two additional digits between 00 and FF.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#p1a {background-color: #ff000080;}   /* red transparency */#p2a {background-color: #00ff0080;}   /* green 
  transparency */#p3a {background-color: #0000ff80;}   /* blue 
  transparency */

content.code:
#p1a {background-color: #ff000080;}   /* red transparency */#p2a {background-color: #00ff0080;}   /* green
transparency */#p3a {background-color: #0000ff80;}   /* blue
transparency */

  transparency */

content.code_html:
#p1a {background-color: #ff000080;}   /* red transparency */
#p2a {background-color: #00ff0080;}   /* green transparency */
#p3a {background-color: #0000ff80;}   /* blue transparency */

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#p1a {background-color: #ff000080;}   /* red transparency */#p2a {background-color: #00ff0080;}   /* green 
  transparency */#p3a {background-color: #0000ff80;}   /* blue 
  transparency */

content.text: RGB Colors
An RGB color value is specified with the rgb() function , which has the following syntax:
content.html: An RGB color value is specified with the rgb() function, which has the following syntax:

content.text: rgb(red, green, blue)
content.html: rgb(red, green, blue)

content.text: Each parameter (red, green, and blue) defines the intensity of the color and can be an integer between 0 and 255 or a percentage value (from 0% to 100%).
content.html: Each parameter (red, green, and blue) defines the intensity of the color and can be an integer between 0 and 255 or a percentage value (from 0% to 100%).

content.text: For example, the rgb(0,0,255) value is rendered as blue, because the blue parameter is set to its highest value (255) and the others are set to 0.
content.html: For example, the rgb(0,0,255) value is rendered as blue, because the blue parameter is set to its highest value (255) and the others are set to 0.

content.text: Also, the following values define equal color: rgb(0,0,255) and rgb(0%,0%,100%).
content.html: Also, the following values define equal color: rgb(0,0,255) and rgb(0%,0%,100%).

syntaxHighlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);}   /* red */#p2 {background-color: rgb(0, 255, 0);}   /* green */#p3 {background-color: rgb(0, 0, 255);}   /* blue */

content.code: #p1 {background-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);}   /* red */#p2 {background-color: rgb(0, 255, 0);}   /* green */#p3 {background-color: rgb(0, 0, 255);}   /* blue */

syntax_highlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);}   /* red */#p2 {background-color: rgb(0, 255, 0);}   /* green */#p3 {background-color: rgb(0, 0, 255);}   /* blue */

content.code_html:
#p1 {background-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);}   /* red */
#p2 {background-color: rgb(0, 255, 0);}   /* green */
#p3 {background-color: rgb(0, 0, 255);}   /* blue */

syntax_highlighting_data.text: #p1 {background-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);}   /* red */#p2 {background-color: rgb(0, 255, 0);}   /* green */#p3 {background-color: rgb(0, 0, 255);}   /* blue */

content.text: RGBA Colors
RGBA color values are an extension of RGB color values with an alpha channel - which specifies the opacity of the object.
content.html: RGBA color values are an extension of RGB color values with an alpha channel - which specifies the opacity of the object.

content.text: An RGBA color is specified with the rgba() function , which has the following syntax:
content.html: An RGBA color is specified with the rgba() function, which has the following syntax:

content.text: rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)
content.html: rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)

content.text: The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).
content.html: The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).

syntaxHighlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3);}   /* red with opacity */#p2 {background-color: rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */#p3 {background-color: rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.3);}   /* blue with opacity */

content.code: #p1 {background-color: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3);}   /* red with opacity */#p2 {background-color: rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */#p3 {background-color: rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.3);}   /* blue with opacity */

syntax_highlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3);}   /* red with opacity */#p2 {background-color: rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */#p3 {background-color: rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.3);}   /* blue with opacity */

content.code_html:
#p1 {background-color: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3);}   /* red with opacity */
#p2 {background-color: rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */
#p3 {background-color: rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.3);}   /* blue with opacity */

syntax_highlighting_data.text: #p1 {background-color: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3);}   /* red with opacity */#p2 {background-color: rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */#p3 {background-color: rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.3);}   /* blue with opacity */

content.text: HSL Colors
HSL stands for hue, saturation, and lightness - and represents a cylindrical-coordinate representation of colors.
content.html: HSL stands for hue, saturation, and lightness - and represents a cylindrical-coordinate representation of colors.

content.text: An HSL color value is specified with the hsl() function , which has the following syntax:
content.html: An HSL color value is specified with the hsl() function, which has the following syntax:

content.text: hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)
content.html: hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)

content.text: Hue is a degree on the color wheel (from 0 to 360) - 0 (or 360) is red, 120 is green, 240 is blue. Saturation is a percentage value; 0% means a shade of gray and 100% is the full color. Lightness is also a percentage; 0% is black, 100% is white.
content.html: Hue is a degree on the color wheel (from 0 to 360) - 0 (or 360) is red, 120 is green, 240 is blue. Saturation is a percentage value; 0% means a shade of gray and 100% is the full color. Lightness is also a percentage; 0% is black, 100% is white.

syntaxHighlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 50%);}   /* green */#p2 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 75%);}   /* light green */#p3 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 25%);}   /* dark green */#p4 {background-color: hsl(120, 60%, 70%);}    /* pastel green */

content.code: #p1 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 50%);}   /* green */#p2 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 75%);}   /* light green */#p3 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 25%);}   /* dark green */#p4 {background-color: hsl(120, 60%, 70%);}    /* pastel green */

#p1 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 50%);}   /* green */

#p3 {background-color: hsl(120, 100%, 25%);}   /* dark green */
#p4 {background-color: hsl(120, 60%, 70%);}    /* pastel green */

content.text: HSLA Colors
HSLA color values are an extension of HSL color values with an alpha channel - which specifies the opacity of the object.
content.html: HSLA color values are an extension of HSL color values with an alpha channel - which specifies the opacity of the object.

content.text: An HSLA color value is specified with the hsla() function , which has the following syntax:
content.html: An HSLA color value is specified with the hsla() function, which has the following syntax:

content.text: hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)
content.html: hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)

content.text: The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).
content.html: The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).

syntaxHighlighting.text: #p1 {background-color: hsla(120, 100%, 50%, 0.3);}   /* green with opacity */#p2 {background-color: hsla(120, 100%, 75%, 0.3);}   /* light green with opacity */#p3 {background-color: hsla(120, 100%, 25%, 0.3);}   /* dark green with opacity */#p4 {background-color: hsla(120, 60%, 70%, 0.3);}    /* pastel green with opacity */

content.text: Predefined/Cross-browser Color Names
140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification.
content.html: 140 color names are predefined in the HTML and CSS color specification.

content.text: For example: blue , red , coral , brown , etc:
content.html: For example: blue, red, coral, brown, etc:

content.code_html:
#p1 {background-color: blue;}
#p2 {background-color: red;}
#p3 {background-color: coral;}
#p4 {background-color: brown;}

content.text: A list of all predefined names can be found in our Color Names Reference .
content.html: A list of all predefined names can be found in our Color Names Reference.

content.text: The currentcolor Keyword
The currentcolor keyword refers to the value of the color property of an element.
content.html: The currentcolor keyword refers to the value of the color property of an element.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
color: blue; /* Blue text color */  border: 10px solid currentcolor; 
  /* Blue border color */

syntax_highlighting.text:
color: blue; /* Blue text color */  border: 10px solid currentcolor;
/* Blue border color */

content.code_html:
#myDIV {
  color: blue; /* Blue text color */
  border: 10px solid currentcolor; /* Blue border color */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
color: blue; /* Blue text color */  border: 10px solid currentcolor; 
  /* Blue border color */
